content.description: Access a small buttress under the south face via the glacier, climb up and right to access a right-trending ramp, belay below a corner system, trend up and left to connect with obvious gash in upper south face. Chimney up the gash to the top. Descent: scramble downward a few hundred feet toward a notch and rappel.
content.protection: Light alpine rack. Many nut placements possible. A few medium cams for the upper pitches. Crampons may be useful in late season.

climbs.name: East Ridge
climbs.fa: F.A. by Fred Beckey, Dave Collins, Ed Cooper in 1958

content.description: Cross over the bergschrund, traverse a series of vegetated ledges, and then climb the ridge onto the east face. Climb a pitch of fist crack (crux) and  traverse the spine to the summit.
content.protection: Single rack from .3 to 3. Double 1 & 2. Six or so smaller stoppers. Â A bunch of alpine draws and double length runners. Bringing rap tat is a good idea. Some of the rap stations use quite long pieces of tat.

pathTokens: Hwy 20 and North Cascades National Park
